sponsor: National Heart, Lung, and Blood Institute (NHLBI)
briefTitle: Trial of Angiotensin Converting Enzyme Inhibition in Infants With Single Ventricle--Pediatric Heart Network
officialTitle: Trial of ACE Inhibition in Infants With Single Ventricle (A Trial Conducted by the Pediatric Heart Network)
summary: This study will evaluate the efficacy and safety of administering an angiotensin converting enzyme inhibitor (ACE-I) (enalapril) to infants with a functional single ventricle. The study will also compare the effect of ACE-I therapy to placebo on somatic growth and compare the effect of ACE-I therapy to placebo on signs and symptoms of heart failure, neurodevelopmental and functional status, ventricular geometry, function, and atrioventricular (AV) valve regurgitation. In addition, the study will determine the relationship between genetic polymorphisms linked to ventricular hypertrophy (enlarged heart) and the response to ACE-I therapy and compare the incidence of adverse events in subjects treated with ACE-I with those in subjects treated with placebo.

primaryOutcome.measure: Weight-for-age Z-score at 14 Months of Age
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Measured at baseline, 2 weeks after starting study drug, just prior to the Glenn surgery, 7 days after restarting drug following the Glenn surgery, at 10 months of age, and at 14 months of age
